attributes.description:
This change is part of the first round of Better Bus Project service updates going into effect this year. 

Changes like this will help improve the reliability and flexibility of our bus system, and are based on feedback from over 3,000 MBTA bus riders like you, along with planners, drivers and consultants.

You can learn more about how were improving bus service throughout the region at mbta.com/betterbus
attributes.header: Starting September 1, 2019, Route 5 will be eliminated. Some Route 5 stops are served by Routes 10 and 16. To learn more about this change and view a map of changes, visit mbta.com/betterbus-5

attributes.description:
Riders looking to exit the Red Line at Central should exit at Kendall. Shuttle pick-up is located at Main St near station entrance for Alewife platform. Riders looking to board at Central should use shuttle service to Kendall. Shuttle pick-up is located on Mass Ave near Elevator 861. Please see an MBTA employee or access a station call box to request shuttle at both Central and Kendall.

Unavailable Elevator:
Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree plat. to street)
attributes.header: Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to street) is out of service through Summer 2019 for replacement. Shuttle service available to/from Central and Kendall stations. Please see an MBTA employee or access a station call box for shuttle.
attributes.short_header: Central Elev. 861 is out of service through Summer 2019 for replacement. Shuttle service available to/from Central & Kendall stations. Pleas

attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line

attributes.description:
During garage construction, 592 spots at the North Quincy Hancock Street lot will be unavailable. More than 600 spots will be available in two surface lots: 
350 spots at Newport Avenue lot 
260 spots at Hancock Street lot 

On weekdays, the Hancock Street lot typically fills by about 7:30 AM, and the Newport Avenue lot fills between 7:45 & 8 AM.

Alternative parking and travel options include: 
403 spots at Wollaston Station during the station closure, with free shuttle service between North Quincy, Quincy Center, and Wollaston Stations.

For more information visit: www.mbta.com/northquincy
attributes.header: Parking has been reduced in the North Quincy Hancock Street Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction of a new garage and mixed retail and residential use building.
attributes.short_header: Parking has been reduced in the N Quincy Hancock St Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction.

attributes.description:
From Route 3, drivers can continue straight on Union Street and use the left 2 lanes to turn left onto Ivory Street. From Ivory Street, take a right to enter the garage and station area. For the drop-off/pick-up area, follow signs to the 2nd level of the garage.

Access for RIDE vans and other ADA compliant vans will remain from the ramp to the busway for both parking and drop-offs/pick-ups.

The Route 3 flyover ramp to the 2nd level of the Braintree Garage is closed due to construction for the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. Learn more at: mbta.com/southshore
attributes.header: Effective March 21, drivers can only access the Braintree Garage and drop-offs/pick-ups from the Ivory Street entrance due to construction. mbta.com/southshore

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428.  

For the Route 111, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Customers may show their CharlieCard to the conductor for travel between Chelsea and North Station, a 10-minute trip. Parking is not available at Chelsea Station. 

Silver Line - SL3: SL3 connects to the Blue Line (via Airport Station), Red Line (via South Station), and the Commuter Rail at Chelsea Station, along with other Silver Line routes. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Inbound SL3 fares are being waived from Chelsea, Bellingham Square, Box District, and Eastern Ave during construction. 

Subway: For Blue Line service, take bus Routes 114, 116, or 117 to Maverick or the SL3 to Airport Station. For Red Line, take the SL3 to South Station. For Orange Line, take the Routes 110 or 112 to Wellington. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Monthly local bus passes are not accepted on SL3 or subway. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Beginning at 10:00 PM on May 13, delays on the Route 111 bus are expected to increase due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek alternate routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge
attributes.short_header: Beginning at 10pm on May 13, delays on the Rt. 111 are expected to increase due to additional lane closures on Rt. 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin

attributes.description:
Riders looking to exit the Red Line at Andrew should exit at Broadway. Shuttle pick-up is located at Dorchester Ave side of Broadway Station. Riders looking to board at Andrew should use shuttle service to Broadway to make Red Line connections. Please see an MBTA employee or access a station call box to request shuttle at both Andrew and Broadway.

The elevators are being taken out of service to facilitate a full replacement of the elevator lifts, hydraulics, and electrical systems.
 
Unavailable Elevators: 
Elevator 872 (Unpaid lobby to street)
Elevator 879 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to paid lobby)
Elevator 880 (Alewife platform to paid lobby)
attributes.header: All elevators at Andrew Station are out of service through Summer 2019 for replacement. Shuttle service available to/from Andrew and Broadway stations. Please see an MBTA employee or access a station call box for shuttle.

attributes.description:

Affected routes:
71
73

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428. 

For the Routes 426 & 428, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Lynn Station (Zone 2 fare) is a 20-minute trip to North Station and daily parking is available for $2. 

Bus Routes: Inner Express Bus Routes 424, 434, 450, 459 or local bus Route 455 connect to downtown Boston and the Orange & Green Lines. Monthly Inner Express Bus passes are valid on these routes and local bus routes/subway. 

Subway: For the Orange Line, take the Route 430 bus from Saugus to Malden Center. For the Blue Line, take local bus Routes 110, 116, 117, 411, 429, 441, 442, 455 or Inner Express Routes 426W, 448 or 449 to Wonderland Station. Monthly Inner Express Bus pass valid for travel on subway and local bus. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Beginning at 10:00 PM on May 13, delays on the Routes 426 & 428 are expected to increase due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek other routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge
attributes.short_header: Beginning at 10pm May 13, delays on Rts. 426 & 428 are expected to increase due to addt'l lane closures on Rt. 1 in Chelsea & Tobin Bridge

attributes.description:
Additional weekends may be added to the train diversion between Porter Square and North Station as work progresses on the Green Line Extension project.

Passengers should allow approximately 30 minutes of travel time between North Station and Porter Square utilizing the subway. There will be no direct connection. 

Outbound trains will depart at their scheduled time from Porter Square. Inbound Fitchburg Line trains will terminate at Porter Square where passengers can connect to the Red Line for service to Boston. Passengers desiring outbound Fitchburg Line service from Boston must take the subway to Porter Square for a commuter rail connection.


All Fitchburg Line trains departing from Porter Square may experience a delay of 5-10 minutes due to the red line connections.
attributes.header: Weekends, August 3-August 25, Fitchburg Line service is suspended in both directions between Porter Sq & North Station for Green Line Ext work. A free subway connection will be provided at Porter Square & N. Station.
attributes.service_effect: Suspension of service on Fitchburg Line

attributes.description:
Regular weekend train service will resume on Saturday, October 19th. 

To get around on the Needham Line during construction, please utilize the following connecting bus/subway service: 

-From Needham Heights, Needham Center, and Needham Junction, the Route 59 bus service connects to Newton Highlands on the Green Line D Branch and to Watertown Square. 

-From West Roxbury, Highland, Bellevue, and Roslindale Village, Bus Routes 35, 36, and 37 connect to and from Forest Hills on the Orange Line, offering connections to Ruggles and Back Bay. 

-Customers who typically board at Hersey Station are encouraged to travel to Needham Junction or West Roxbury Station on the Orange Line, as there are no connecting MBTA services at Hersey.

Please note that the Needham line normally does not have Sunday service. 

Learn more about PTC on the MBTA website : https://www.mbta.com/projects/commuter-rail-positive-train-control-ptc
attributes.header: From August 3 until October 12, there will be no weekend Needham Line train service while Positive Train Control systems are being installed.
